intro: Veronica circaeoides, commonly known as the blueweed or field veronica, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and produces small, blue or violet flowers in clusters during the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Veronica circaeoides is often found in grassy areas, along roadsides, and in disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
